Class SmartServoLIN

All Implemented Interfaces:
com.kuka.roboticsAPI.commandModel.IAction, com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.IKROSMotion, com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.IMotion, com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.IMotionWithDestinationFrame, com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.IParameterizable, com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.IServoMotion
public class SmartServoLIN
extends com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.ServoMotionCP<SmartServoLIN>
implements com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.IMotionWithDestinationFrame

A linear smart servo motion is a cartesian linear motion to a given frame.

This class is used as follows:
SmartServoLIN aSmartServoLINMotion = new SmartServoLINMotion(AbstractFrame destination);

physicalObject.moveAsync(aSmartServoLINMotion)

protected static final int MAXNUMBERROWS
Maximal allowed number of trace rows.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

SmartServoLIN

public SmartServoLIN(com.kuka.roboticsAPI.geometricModel.AbstractFrame destination)
Creates a new linear smart servo motion in the cartesian space to the given frame.

Hint: If you like to program defensively, inquire the current Position from the device (see robot.getCurrentCartesianPosition())

Parameters:
destination - The initial target destination.
Method Detail

getRuntime

public ISmartServoLINRuntime getRuntime()
Inquire the runtime information.

NOTE: It is available AFTER the motion has been activated, that means a call like
((PhysicalObject)toolAttachedToRobot).moveAsync(smartServoLIN);
has been issued.

Overrides:
getRuntime in class com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.ServoMotion<SmartServoLIN>
Returns:
the smartServoLIN Runtime

getDestination in interface com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.IMotionWithDestinationFrame

setSpeedTimeoutAfterGoalReach

public SmartServoLIN setSpeedTimeoutAfterGoalReach(double speedTimeoutAfterGoalReach)
Sets the timeout after which the robot starts to brake after the goal has been reached. Works only in velocity planning mode.

Note: To use this feature the velocity planning mode has to be activated by calling ISmartServoLINRuntime.activateVelocityPlanning(boolean).

Default timeout is 0.0, the maximal value is 0.1 seconds.

Parameters:
speedTimeoutAfterGoalReach - the timeout in seconds.
Returns:
self
See Also:
ServoMotion.getSpeedTimeoutAfterGoalReach()

setNumberOfTraceRows

public SmartServoLIN setNumberOfTraceRows(int numberOfTraceRows)
Option to activate and set the trace for the SmartServoLIN parameters.

Parameters:
numberOfTraceRows - the number of rows in the trace file.
Use 0 to deactivate the trace. Maximal trace time is 500000
Returns:
self
